Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on democratic freedoms and free speech.
The government is exempt from the bill, allowing it to potentially spread misinformation without consequence.
The bill could be used to silence dissenting opinions and opposition parties.
It represents an overreach of government power, likened to totalitarian regimes.
The bill could harm the independence of digital platforms by forcing them to adhere to government-imposed codes.
Existing legal frameworks for defamation are sufficient to address misinformation without additional government intervention.
The scope of the bill is too broad, allowing ACMA to define truth across various societal areas.
Notable Quotes: This is the control of speech and open debate by the Government and it is an attack on the basis of our democracy.
It is totalitarian in the extreme and Josef Stalin would be proud.
The Government using private businesses to enforce its control of the population is a hallmark of fascist totalitarianism and we condemn it utterly.
We cannot allow this to happen. Again, we ask that the Government withdraw this Bill.
